alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Deuel; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 2:11AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, southwestern Cherry, Grant, northwestern Keith, northwestern Hooker, eastern Garden, southeastern Sheridan and northeastern Deuel Counties through 200 AM MDT... At 110 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Ashby to 6 miles south of Lewellen. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Lewellen, Hyannis, Whitman, Ashby, Duluth, Swede Lake, Cogill Lake, Green Lake, Bourquim Hill, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Carr Lake, Haythorn Lake, Clear Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Rackett, Finnegan Lake and Lena. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 126 and 167. Highway 61 between mile markers 105 and 175. Highway 92 between mile markers 115 and 128, and between mile markers 165 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Deuel; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Sheridan; Western Cherry
